Hi,

I use a datagrid and do the following:

<dg:DataGrid.RowDetailsTemplate> 
<DataTemplate> 
<Border BorderBrush="Red" BorderThickness="2" HorizontalAlignment="Stretch" CornerRadius="2" Background="Black" Margin="3" Padding="2"> 
<Grid HorizontalAlignment="Stretch" Margin="5"> 
<Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
<ColumnDefinition Width="100"/>
<ColumnDefinition Width="*"/>
</Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
<Label Foreground="Wheat">Detail Info:</Label>
<TextBlock Grid.Column="1" Foreground="CadetBlue" FontSize="20" HorizontalAlignment="Right" Margin="5" Text="Test" /> 
</Grid> 
</Border> 
</DataTemplate>
</dg:DataGrid.RowDetailsTemplate>

 

 

 

 

 

Further I set:  RowDetailsVisibilityMode="VisibleWhenSelected"

When I select a row the Border is not completly displayed.
Some parts are missing on the right side.
If I make the grid larger (drag up the window) the right side comes in view.
Making it a bit smaller bring up a scrollbar - if I click on it it disapears.


Anyhow: Is there a workaround for this?
What I need is a details pane with a border showing some values "spreaded".
So the label is on the first Colum - the content on the second colums - right aligned.

I hope anyone can help (and I guess I simply made a silly mistake :))

Manfred

Hi,

I cut and paste your RowTemplate into a grid that I have and it works just fine, the border is visible and occupies the entire horizontal area.

Perhaps the problem lies in your DataGrid configuration. Can you perhaps provide a more complete example?

Regards,
Colin E.

Simply try to make the grid fill the entire window and then resize the window.

Important -- it seems as if the problem comes up more reproducable when a vertical scrollbar exists.

And it has about 200 lines of data (so it always scrolls).
